Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

Bizarre.  I had tested the first of my two examples and it failed to set the
first neuron's output to zero.  I haven't done the simple test in isolation
- I just assumed that first test was real.
On Jan 13, 2011 6:24 AM, "Rob Marsden" <rob@...> wrote:
> No, in C and C++, the increment is atomic to the expression. So it is
> bound to the 'n' at the time the increment, which happens at the end of
> the loop, and cannot extend over the loop as a whole.
>
> On 13/01/2011 13:14, Robert DeLisle wrote:
>> In the case off parsing vectors, does it not skip the element at 0?
>>
>
>
> --
> Rob Marsden
> Gistix (Northern) Limited

--000325574bbeb6f71f0499bab692
